basics.name: Matthew Sahara
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am studying for a B.S. in Electrical Engineering, Electro-Physics in the Department of Electrical Engineering at the University of Hawaii. I expect to graduate in Fall 2020.

work.company: University of Hawaii - College of Engineering
work.summary: Focusing on Cyber Security training and research in respect to drone applications.
highlights: Co-leads a team of 6 students in drone network-traffic analysis research
Helps to guide new students in basic wireless network security penetration techniques
Collects drone communication data and analyzes characteristic data trends using Python3

work.summary: Intern in the Electrical Department for the Aviation and Federal group.
highlights: Prepared duct bank details and grounding diagram for medium voltage switchgear
Updated and reviewed one-line diagram with medium and low voltage cables for microgrid
Designed controls one-line and network architecture details for SCADA monitoring system
Backchecked lighting calcs, panelboard schedules, motor sizes, and electrical drawings

work.company: University of Hawaii - College of Engineering
work.summary: Facilitated one section of an introductory programming course in C.
highlights: Led class discussions and examples on important C concepts
Held weekly office hours to tutor students regarding C programming and Unix
Graded and provides constructive feedback to students on laboratory assignments

work.summary: Worked as part of a team to maintain the two major data centers at UH Manoa.
highlights: Installed network devices, equipment, and connections throughout the data centers
Used data center management software to keep track of network devices and connections
Managed return merchandise authorization (RMA) cases for faulty electronics

volunteer.summary: Founding board member of interdisciplinary engineering club, focusing on unique social networking opportunities with other colleges and organizations.
highlights: Created and managed the club website as acting Director of Multimedia and Publications in Spring 2018.
Helped to organize and coordinate two social events and one community service event with the Ronald McDonald House Charities Hawaii.

volunteer.summary: Helped to manage over 35 trumpet players, while working as a part of a leadership team to ensure productive rehearsals.

awards.title: Chancellor's Scholarship
awards.summary: 4-year Merit Scholarship awarded to high-achieving incoming UH Manoa freshmen.

awards.title: Eagle Scout
awards.summary: My Eagle Scout service project consisted of organizing and leading a team of over 30 people to rebuild a rotten wooden ramp for the Saint Francis Hospice Care program in Nuuanu. We also re-painted the ramp and its respective cottage, which now can be used for patient counseling.
